intro: Picramnia glazioviana subsp. amplifoliola, commonly known as the broadleaf picramnia, is a shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lanceolate to ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in cymes, and its fruits are follicles containing several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger, more robust leaves compared to other members of the species.
